events.title: Weather tracker: Spain and Portugal hit by third deadly storm in two weeks
events.description: Storm Marta sweeps Iberian peninsula just days after Storms Kristin and Leonardo brought deadly flooding and major damage Spain and Portugal have endured another storm over the weekend, just days after the deadly flooding and major damage caused by Storm Kristin and Storm Leonardo last week. Storm Marta passed over the Iberian peninsula on Saturday, bringing fresh torrential rain and killing two people. Storm Kristin killed at least five people after it made landfall on 28 January with Storm Leonardo claiming another victim last Wednesday . The outlook for this week is for more rain across Spain, Portugal and France, especially across north-west Portugal, where more than 100mm is possible during the first half of the week. Some of the heaviest of the rain will transfer to southern Italy and western parts of Greece and Turkey later in the week. Continue reading...

events.title: Australia politics live: man charged after Sydney protest over police tactics; speculation mounts over Taylor resignation
events.description: Another night of demonstrations in Sydney after criticism of police actions at Monday‚Äôs protest. Follow updates live Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The former prime minister Malcolm Turnbull has defended the government‚Äôs invitation to Isaac Herzog , and said he should be ‚Äúrespected as a guest‚Äù while he visits. Speaking to ABC RN Breakfast this morning, Turnbull said protesters should have demonstrated ‚Äúpeacefully‚Äù and heeded the advice of police. But he added that in hindsight, the police should have allowed men who were praying on the street to finish. The men were captured on film being dragged on the ground by officers. Nobody is justified in assaulting police and they should have complied with the lawful directions from the police. I don‚Äôt know the whole context, but one would have hoped that the police would have waited for the prayers to be concluded, frankly ‚Ä¶ I think in retrospect, I‚Äôm sure they feel they would have been better off letting them conclude their prayers. I think the question people will ask after this visit is whether the visit from President Herzog has assisted in making it very clear that the Jewish community in Australia should not be targets of or the objects of protests against the state of Israel. I mean, the one thing we have to be clear about in this multicultural society of ours is that we cannot allow foreign wars to be fought out here. The police need to come out with a public apology. There needs to be an investigation. There are some red lines and that was crossed last night. That is simply unacceptable, and the police force should know better.... there is no excuse. Continue reading...
events.ticker_label: ü™ñ Australia politics live: man charged after Sydney protest over police tactics; speculation mounts over Taylor resignation

events.title: Hong Kong‚Äôs once-vibrant press stays silent or celebrates Jimmy Lai‚Äôs 20-year jail sentence
events.description: Lack of response shows security law and harassment by authorities have muzzled ‚Äòcritical voices‚Äô, say experts The rise and fall of Jimmy Lai, whose trajectory mirrored that of Hong Kong itself Hong Kong‚Äôs once-vibrant media outlets have responded with silence or celebration to the 20-year jail sentence handed down to Jimmy Lai, a pro-democracy media tycoon and critic of the Chinese Communist party. Lai, 78, was sentenced on Monday to 20 years in prison after being convicted of sedition and colluding with foreign forces under Hong Kong‚Äôs national security law. The charges were widely seen as being politically motivated and designed to silence one of Hong Kong‚Äôs most influential pro-democracy campaigners. Continue reading...

events.title: Jimmy Lai: Hong Kong media tycoon gets 20 years in jail ‚Äì The Latest

events.title: Netanyahu heads to Washington to meet Trump with Iran missiles high on agenda
events.description: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu headed to Washington Tuesday where he said the top priority in his talks with US President Donald Trump would be the ongoing negotiations with Iran, as he presses for a tougher US approach to Tehran's ballistic missile programme.
events.ticker_label: ü™ñ Netanyahu heads to Washington to meet Trump with Iran missiles high on agenda

events.title: 'Don't jump in them': Olympic athletes' medals break during celebrations
events.description: Handle with care. That's the message from gold medalist Breezy Johnson at the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics after she and other athletes found their medals broke within hours. Olympic organizers are investigating with ‚Äúmaximum attention‚Äù after a spate of medals fell off their ribbons during celebrations on the opening weekend of the Games.

events.title: REPLAY: Epstein survivors and lawmakers introduce 'Virginia's Law'
events.description: Democrats and survivors of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein introduced a bill at a press conference Tuesday to introduce a "Virginia's Law", named after Epstein victim Virginia Giuffre. The legislation would end statute of limitation barriers to filing a lawsuit. Watch the press conference in full above.

events.title: Mugabe, Zuma among high-profile Africans named in Epstein files
events.description: It's been just over a week since the latest batch of documents were released from the Epstein Files. 3 million of them have now been made public, and while no wrongdoing has been found against them, the names of several high-profile African figures are included in them, including former presidents Robert Mugabe and Jacob Zuma.

events.title: Savannah Guthrie says, 'We believe our mom is still out there'
events.description: U.S. ‚Å†television network news host Savannah Guthrie, who said her family has reached "an hour of desperation," pleaded for the public's help on Monday in locating her elderly mother, presumed kidnapped for ransom more than a week ago from her Arizona home. Nine days into a round-the-clock search for Nancy Guthrie, 84, the Pima County Sheriff's Department said on Monday that investigators ‚Äãstill had not identified "any suspects, persons of interest or vehicles connected to" her disappearance.
events.ticker_label: üí• Savannah Guthrie says, 'We believe our mom is still out there'

events.title: Tearful Olympian admits to cheating on girlfriend after medal win
events.description: Norwegian Olympian Sturla Holm Laegreid confessed in a live television interview to cheating on his girlfriend, moments after winning a bronze medal.

events.title: Irish man detained for months in 'concentration camp' by ICE
events.description: An Irishman who has been detained by ICE for five months has described the facilities as "like a modern-day concentration camp".

events.title: Have a baby while you still can, France to tell 29-year-olds
events.description: All 29-year-old French citizens are to be encouraged by their government to have babies while they still can.

events.title: William didn't react to Epstein question - but his actions on Saudi trip have been telling
events.description: There was no reaction but we know Prince William and his team at least heard the shout, even if they didn't hear the full question.

events.title: The mayor of Ecuador's largest port arrested on money laundering and tax evasion charges
events.description: Ecuador's Attorney General's office says the mayor of Guayaquil has been arrested on charges of money laundering and tax evasion

events.title: Venezuelan opposition politician placed under house arrest after release from jail, son says
events.description: Juan Pablo Guanipa, an ally of Venezuela's opposition leader Mar√≠a Corina Machado, has been placed under house arrest

events.title: EU lawmakers agree on migration policies easing deportations, drawing criticism
events.description: European lawmakers have approved a new immigration policy allowing nations to deny asylum and deport migrants from countries deemed safe

events.title: French prosecutor searches for victims after a man is accused of abusing 89 minors over 55 years
events.description: French authorities have revealed the identity of a 79-year-old man accused of raping and sexually assaulting 89 minors over five decades

events.title: Passenger plane in Somalia overshoots the runway into shallow seawater near the airport
events.description: A passenger aircraft carrying 55 people veered off the runway at Somalia‚Äôs main airport and ended up on in shallow water at a nearby beach

events.title: EU drafts a list of concessions it says Russia must make to secure real peace in Ukraine
events.description: The European Union is drafting a list of concessions it believes Russia must make for long-term peace to be achieved in Ukraine

events.title: South Korea will boost medical school admissions to tackle physician shortage
events.description: South Korea plans to increase medical school admissions by over 3,340 students from 2027 to 2031 to address physician shortages

events.title: Russia thinks it can outsmart the US during Ukraine talks, intelligence chief says
events.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin shows no desire to end Russia‚Äôs invasion of Ukraine, according to a senior European intelligence official

events.title: Misery deepens in the West Bank as Israel provides few Palestinian work permits
events.description: Many Palestinians in the occupied West Bank are struggling to get by after losing their permits to work inside Israel

events.title: Meet Chile's first rugby team created inside a prison
events.description: Chile's first prison rugby team is transforming lives at the Valpara√≠so Penitentiary Complex

events.title: DR Congo: UN vows orderly peacekeeping transition as South Africa withdraws troops
events.description: South Africa has moved to withdraw its peacekeepers deployed at the United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (MONUSCO) after nearly three decades of service.

events.title: Second alleged Guthrie ransom deadline missed, sparking new theories from Bongino, former FBI agent and doctor
events.description: Nancy Guthrie disappearance enters ninth day as experts question alleged $6 million Bitcoin ransom demands and kidnapping theory validity in ongoing case.

events.title: Ohio man found dead inside trash compactor at pharmacy after wife tracks his location
events.description: Ohio father of two Andrew Strand found dead in CVS trash compactor after his wife tracked his phone when he didn't return home from a contractor job.

events.title: Minnesota woman sentenced to prison for $325K SNAP fraud scheme
events.description: A Minnesota woman was sentenced to prison for $325,000 SNAP fraud scheme involving fake identities and pregnancy claims to steal government benefits illegally.

events.title: Nicaragua blocks pathway used by Cuban migrants to reach the US
events.description: Nicaragua blocks Cuban citizens from entering without visas, eliminating a key migration route to the U.S. border through Central America and Mexico.

events.title: UK public health system posts job ad for nurse focused on 'close-relative marriage'
events.description: UK health agency advertises nursing role for families in cousin marriages linked to higher genetic risks for children in controversial health program.

events.title: Venezuelan opposition leader seized by armed men after being released from jail
events.description: Mar√≠a Corina Machado said Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Pablo Guanipa was seized by armed men in Caracas after his release from prison.

events.title: Japan's 'Iron Lady' thanks Trump as party secures historic supermajority
events.description: Japan's Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi wins historic supermajority in snap election, earning Trump's praise for her "landslide victory" and conservative agenda.

events.title: Trump's special envoy Witkoff and Kushner visit US aircraft carrier amid Iran tensions, talks
events.description: Trump envoy Witkoff and Jared Kushner visited the USS Abraham Lincoln amid Iran tensions as Netanyahu prepares a Washington meeting to discuss limiting Tehran's ballistic missiles.
